alert.note: Alert for Baker; Calhoun; Dougherty; Early; Miller; Mitchell (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 28 at 7:30AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Miller, southwestern Dougherty, central Mitchell, Baker, southeastern Calhoun and central Early Counties in southwestern Georgia through 815 AM EDT... At 730 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Arlington, or 10 miles east of Blakely, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newton, Blakely, Arlington, Douglasville, Centerville, Damascus, Iveys Mill, Milford, Red Store Crossroads, Crestview, Rock Hill, Cuba, Hawkinstown, Mimsville, Early Co A/p, Old Damascus, Elmodel Wma, Bethany, Hentown and Patmos. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Baker; Calhoun; Dougherty; Early; Miller; Mitchell
